duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide professional nursing care for patients including assessment, treatment, care planning, and medical care and evaluation.
Assist physicians and staff in coordinating patient care and function as a primary liaison between patients, staff, and physicians.
Obtain patient consent for care, ensure patient confidentiality, and assess disease condition.
Administer prescribed treatments, medications, and monitor treatment progress and patient response.
Educate patients and families about health status, health maintenance, and management of acute and chronic conditions.
Maintain accurate inventory of all medications and respond to incoming patient treatment-related phone calls.
Administer all medications: PO, IV, SC, IM as prescribed and coordinate treatment plans for patients.
Schedule follow-up appointments and collaborate with the research department as required.
Maintain patient confidentiality and perform other clinical duties as deemed appropriate by nursing management/supervisor.

education_certification.credential: RN degree. Completion of nursing training from an accredited school of nursing. BSN preferred. Minimum of 3 years professional nursing experience. Minimum of 1 year infusion experience in acute, outpatient, home and/or physician office setting. Gastroenterology experience preferred. Current state registered nurse license. Current CPR certificate. CRNI certification preferred.
